alert.note: Alert for Monroe (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 7:57AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A Couple of Strong Thunderstorms will Impact Craig, Monroe, and Alleghany Counties Through 830 AM EDT... At 752 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking two strong thunderstorms. One was located between Maggie and Sweet Springs whlie the other was located near Covington, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Locally heavy rainfall and occasional cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor flooding in poor drainage areas. Dangerous cloud-to- ground lightning. Locations impacted include... Alleghany... Covington... Clifton Forge... Paint Bank... Jordan Mines... Natural Well... and Selma. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
